intro: Biscutella longifolia subsp. kerneri, commonly known as Kern’s biscuit flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple, typically in late spring to early summer. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy, with stems that are often hairy as well. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
